{"step_by_step_thinking": "The free gingival graft is a procedure where a small layer of tissue is removed from the palate of the patient's mouth and then relocated to the site of gum recession. According to Document [5], the surface epithelium of free gingival grafts degenerates and re-epithelizes by cells proliferating from adjacent tissues. This means that the epithelium of the graft does not remain as such, nor does it need to be removed by the surgeon. Instead, it degenerates and then regenerates or proliferates from the cells of the surrounding tissues.", "answer_choice": "C. Degenerates"}
